## Requirements

## Interactive content when exporting to PDF

In general, this template tries to do a good job of automatically handling (i.e. ignoring) interactive content when exporting to PDF. A notable exception is with embedded interactive content like external GIFs. In this case, rather than type the usual, say, `![](mind-blown.gif)` directly in the Rmd file, render the figure (conditional on output) in an R chunk using `knitr::include_graphics`. For example:

```{r gif_example, out.width='100%'}
fmt <- rmarkdown::default_output_format(knitr::current_input())$name
if (fmt == "html_document"){
  knitr::include_graphics('mind-blown.gif')
}
if (fmt == "pdf_document"){
  message("Sorry, this GIF only available in the the HTML version of the notes.")
}
```
